abstract: SoftBank, a Japanese Internet and communications company, is betting that it can break the dominance of Verizon and AT&T in the United States.
snippet: SoftBank, a Japanese Internet and communications company, is betting that it can break the dominance of Verizon and AT&T in the United States.
lead_paragraph: SoftBank of Japan is making its biggest gamble yet: entering the American cellphone market.

headline.main: Deal to Buy Sprint Is SoftBank’s Biggest Gamble
headline.print_headline: Deal to Buy Sprint Is SoftBank’s Biggest Gamble

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced

abstract: Goldman Sachs swung to a profit in the third quarter. | Andrew Ross Sorkin says lawsuits brought by the government “may have a profound impact” on how businesses view the next crisis. | SoftBank is betting it can break the dominance of Verizon and AT&T.
snippet: Goldman Sachs swung to a profit in the third quarter. | Andrew Ross Sorkin says lawsuits brought by the government “may have a profound impact” on how businesses view the next crisis. | SoftBank is betting it can break the dominance of Verizon and...
lead_paragraph: GOLDMAN BEATS EXPECTATIONS  |  Goldman Sachs may be getting its groove back. The Wall Street firm said on Tuesday that it swung to a profit in the third quarter, reporting net earnings applicable to common shareholders of $1.46 billion, compared with a loss of $428 million in the quarter a year ago. The third-quarter profit amounted to $2.85 a share, beating the $2.12 a share analysts were expecting. Goldman also said it was increasing its dividend to 50 cents from 46 cents. (The conference call to discuss the results is at 9:30 a.m. Dial 1-888-281-7154 to listen in the United States.)
